snippet: After years of tension between the two movements, both have made an effort to reach common ground on issues like same-sex marriage and the New York police’s stop-and-frisk policy.
abstract: Gay rights organizations and black civil rights leaders are making progress in their effort to find common ground and support their respective causes, reversing years of tension and mutual mistrust; several gay rights organizations have announced that they will march alongside civil rights leaders to protest the New York Police Department's stop-and-frisk practice, citing the NAACP's previous endorsement of same-sex marriage.
lead_paragraph: After years of tension between the two movements, both have made an effort to reach common ground on issues like same-sex marriage and the New York police’s stop-and-frisk policy.

headline.seo: Black Leaders and Gay Advocates Find Ways to March in Step
